parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The knee. Of uncertain affinity; the 'knee'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From keimai; to put to sleep, i.e. to slumber; figuratively, to decease.
